content:
Hi FHIR implementers:

Shouldn't the attached give a validation error in the tooling? (Simplifier.net, HL7Validator)

Because the fixedCode being constrained to is _not_ in the required valueSet binding (inherited from the baseDefinition)

<element id="Observation.value[x]:valueQuantity.code">
<path value="Observation.value[x].code" />
<fixedCode value="kg/m3" />
<binding>
<strength value="required" />
<valueSet value="http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/ucum-vitals-common" />
</binding>
</element>

The tools accept this, surprisingly (to me), even though kg/m3 is NOT in the said valueSet.

Welcoming your perspectives!

image.png
image.png
you should get an error if you try to validate against the profile, since there's no instance that can meet those contradictory constraints

Validators don't necessarily check fixed or default values against value sets - though doing that is a good idea. You could submit that as an enhancement request to Simplifier. (And they'll create a standard test case, which means the capability should eventually make it into the Java validator too :) )
@Ward Weistra - we will submit a ticket :)
